Hey Aish, please meet Toby your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
_@dexter has left the channel_
_@dexter has left the channel_
Hello Aish! Hope everything bid going great with you?
Hi Toby nice to meet you, I'm alright - how are you?
I'm really excited for this mentorship, I also want to be an animator in the future :) at the moment I am doing an animation EPQ alongside my alevels
Can you tell me more about how you got into animation?

Im doing well, great to hear! Could you let me know what an EPQ is? I don't think I've ever heard of one... Things changed since I was at school :smiley: 
I'm at work right now, so I'd be happy to give you my blurb when I get home in a few hours. You could check out my linked in profile as will give you a little idea about my history <http://LinkedIn.com/in/tobywinder/|LinkedIn.com/in/tobywinder/>
Let me know if you have any other questions for me and I'll get to them too :)

Ah I'm not sure maybe it's just an option in london- an EPQ is an extended project qualification it's the equivalent of an AS but u like an AS rather than A being the highest grade you can get an A*. It's ultimately a research project which you can choose to go down an essay pathway or to make an artefact :)
Aw my bad, sure I will do - and sometimes time if you wouldn't mind looking over my personal statement and CV I'd appreciate it - I actually need to do some biology revision:)
I'd happily take a look at them. You can email them to me on <mailto:winder.toby@googlemail.com|winder.toby@googlemail.com>
EPQ sounds cool! Wish I had that option :)

so I kind of got into animation a little hap hazardly. Originally I was interested in doing architecture at university - but I didn't fancy doing the A level pysics that was required for that! honestly at that point I had never even considered that animation existed as a career. One day I was scrolling through the UCAS list of courses and university and I found an animation course.
Really I ended up picking it becuase i like animation - i didnt think too hard about it. (I dont recommend this) This being said it makes total sense. I absolutely looove jurassic park's dinosaurs.

Anyway I went to study animation at a college/uni called Ravensbourne. Most of the way through uni I was very technically focused. I wanted to do character rigging etc.
So I graduated, with a very average looking short film and pretty terrible showreel :slightly_smiling_face: I was lucky to find a  few weeks of free training in a field called matchmoving (I'm not sure how much you know about VFX workflow? ) and then again I was lucky as my brother works in vfx also he maanged to help me find an entry job as a matchmover at Framestore!
So I was in the industry I got to work on a bunch of cool films while i was matchmoving. Buuut matchmoving is not the most exciting thing. I ended up sitting next to an animator so I was always looking over his shoulder to see what he was doing.
He recommended that I do a course at <http://animationmentor.com|animationmentor.com>. So this is what I ended up doing!
When i was nearly done with the course I got my first animation job at a small studio that was doing a really low budget animated feature, I worked at that company for a year or so but the film never actually happened :disappointed: from there I jumped back into film VFX but i never maanged to get to work on many exciting projects. So I ended up doing a little stint of animating in games and then freelance animating at lost of small studios around london for a few years.
Eventually I managed to build a decent showreel and I applied for some jobs in Canada, and i landed  an animation job in Montreal at Framestore. From there I worked a little bit and then hoped over to MOC and now Rodeo FX (where i am now)

Its very brief - but it gives you the gist!
I actually don't use LinkedIn - although I should
Woah that's quite the journey - I know a bit about  VFX like pipelining but idk about matchmoving. What software do you mostly use for your animation :) I've only used blender before
Thanks I will send them to your email :), it's very cool although I'm a little stressed carrying it on top of my NEA English coursework and biology - I think it will be worth it though
I'm actually a little stuck on where I wasn't to go for uni/an apprenticeship- last year I wanted to do computer science but after working on animations I realised that's what I wanted to peruse
